moves.1. e4: I'll name this annotation "The Trojan Horse" - standard King's Pawn opening
moves.1... e5: Épine Dorsale - mutual King's Pawn opening
moves.2. Nf3: Develop King's Knight - which is customary for me leading to my preferred Scotch Game, or Ruy Lopez when I'm feeling more aggressive
moves.3. Nxe5: Damiano Gambit - poison chess at it's greatest.  It's an enticing capture that should be avoided, because that "piece" offering comes with bad intentions.
moves.3... fxe5: Gambit accepted, a common mistake taking the knight - which I refer to as the Trojan Horse
moves.4. Qh5+: Once the Trojan Horse has been invited inside the walls of Troy, it's only a matter of time before the Spartans sack the city.
moves.4... Ke7: From my frame of reference, Checkmate is inevitable at this point
moves.5. Qxe5+: Keep Black's King in check, to separate further from his defenses
moves.6. Bc4+: Continued development for White, all while Black's future options are continuing to look bleak
moves.6... Kg6: Bad option for Black, sacrificing the Queen's Pawn in order to free up the Queen's Bishop, while attacking White's KB, would have been a more prudent option
moves.7. Qf5+: The Spartans are running wild in the city!
moves.7... Kh6: Only move at this point, when your King is beyond your defenses - it's not a good place to be
moves.8. d4+: Again, continued development for White while keeping Black in check
moves.8... g5: Only move available for Black, # of moves for Checkmate is dependent upon White's response
moves.9. h4: First move in many that White does not check Black (please see above comment)
moves.9... Kg7: Shouldn't have been surprised by another poor move by Black, although I was....  Black may have prolonged Checkmate by KB to e7
moves.10. Qf7+: It's as good as over with another check
moves.11. hxg5#:
Checkmate in 11 - take away, avoid poison pieces & expect the unexpected through respect of your opponent, assume their "mistake" was made intentionally - with bad intentions...

read Sun Tzu's Art of War for a fuller appreciation of these strategic theories.
